content:
AuNCs were synthesized in a water bath according to a previous report at 70 °C. Concisely, the aqueous solution of HAuCl4·4H2O (40 mM, 1 mL) was mixed with GSH (100 mM, 0.6 mL) and ultrapure water (18.4 mL). Then the solution was heated to 70 °C under stirring for 24 h and then cooled to 0 °C. The AuNCs were purified using a dialysis bag. The purified AuNCs solution was adjusted to 20 mL and stored at 4 °C for the following experiments.

Synthesis of AuNCs@ZIF-8 Nanocomposites

AuNCs@ZIF-8 was synthesized according to a previously reported method with a little revision. One milliliter of AuNCs was precipitated with Zn­(NO3)2 aqueous solution (80 μL, 40 mg mL–1). After removal of the supernatant, the precipitated AuNCs were speedily injected into the mixture of Zn­(NO3)2 methanol solution (2 mL, 35 mM) and 2-methylimidazole (2-Melm) methanol solution (2 mL, 160 mM) under magnetic stirring (500 rpm). After 12 h, the resulting precipitate was centrifuged, washed, and vacuum-dried at 60 °C to obtain a light yellow powder. In the following assays, the final concentration of AuNCs@ZIF-8 in the system was 500 μg mL–1 and the dosage of free AuNCs (or free ZIF-8) was the same between AuNCs@ZIF-8 and AuNCs groups (or ZIF-8 group).

Bacterial Cell Culture

E. coli and S. aureus were selected as model bacteria. They were cultured in a LB medium at 37 °C with shaking at 250 rpm for 20 h. After centrifugation (3000 rpm, 10 min), the cultured bacteria were dispersed in PBS at a concentration of 1 × 108 CFU mL–1 for the following experiments.
clean_text:
Synthesis of AuNCs

AuNCs were synthesized in a water bath according to a previous report at 70 °C. Concisely, the aqueous solution of HAuCl4⋅4H2O (40 mM, 1 mL) was mixed with GSH (100 mM, 0.6 mL) and ultrapure water (18.4 mL). Then the solution was heated to 70 °C under stirring for 24 h and then cooled to 0 °C. The AuNCs were purified using a dialysis bag. The purified AuNCs solution was adjusted to 20 mL and stored at 4 °C for the following experiments.

Synthesis of AuNCs@ZIF-8 Nanocomposites

AuNCs@ZIF-8 was synthesized according to a previously reported method with a little revision. One milliliter of AuNCs was precipitated with Zn(NO3)2 aqueous solution (80 μL, 40 mg mL-1). After removal of the supernatant, the precipitated AuNCs were speedily injected into the mixture of Zn(NO3)2 methanol solution (2 mL, 35 mM) and 2-methylimidazole (2-Melm) methanol solution (2 mL, 160 mM) under magnetic stirring (500 rpm). After 12 h, the resulting precipitate was centrifuged, washed, and vacuum-dried at 60 °C to obtain a light yellow powder. In the following assays, the final concentration of AuNCs@ZIF-8 in the system was 500 μg mL-1 and the dosage of free AuNCs (or free ZIF-8) was the same between AuNCs@ZIF-8 and AuNCs groups (or ZIF-8 group).

Bacterial Cell Culture

 E. coli and S. aureus were selected as model bacteria. They were cultured in a LB medium at 37 °C with shaking at 250 rpm for 20 h. After centrifugation (3000 rpm, 10 min), the cultured bacteria were dispersed in PBS at a concentration of 1 × 108 CFU mL-1 for the following experiments.
